stories.text:
I'm a longtime fan of PG's ideas about startup hubs and the power of SF/SV networks. Right now it seems like the consensus is shifting towards remote or virtual hubs.

I know this might be a redundant question, but between the cost of living, crime, and toxic work-cultures of SF/SV I wonder if this is still a great place to go for people who love startups and tech. Are there any SF natives who can chime in and say whether or not SF/SV as a "hub" is strong enough to withstand this downswing? I understand this question involves a lot of generalization but I'm just trying to get a feel for what people think rn
stories.title: Any Thoughts on Moving to SF?

stories.text:
I'm tired of everything being political.

I'm tired of constant political emails.

I'm tired of putting my pronouns everywhere.

I'm tired of diversity training.

I'm tired of being ostracized for not believing in wokeism.

I'm tired of social justice.

I'm tired of companies saying they want diversity of thought but disallowing employees to have diversity of thought.

The worst thing I ever did was waste my time to pursue a career in this industry. It is toxic from the top to the bottom.

So, I'm done. I will never work for big tech again. The money isn't worth it. I'd rather be paid half the salary at a normal company that doesn't feel like a neo-communist enclave.

Let the downvotes and societal sanctioned harassment begin.
stories.title: I will never work in big tech again
